sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Network Adequacy and Transparency Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Network Adequacy and Transparency Act.

sections.heading: Applicability of Act. This Act applies to an individual or group policy of accident and health insurance with a network plan amended, delivered, issued, or renewed in this State on or after January 1, 2019
sections.text: This Act does not apply to an individual or group policy for dental or vision insurance or a

sections.heading: Provider requirements. Providers shall comply with 42 U
sections.text: S.C. 300gg-138 and 300gg-139 and the regulations promulgated thereunder, as well as Section 20, paragraph (2) of subsection (a) of Section 25, subsections (h) and (j) of Section 25, and Section 36 of this Act, except that "provider directory in

sections.heading: Funds for enforcement. Moneys from fines and penalties collected from issuers for violations of this Act shall be deposited into the Insurance Producer Administration Fund for appropriation by the General Assembly to the Department to be used for providing financial support of the Department's enfor
sections.text: Funds for enforcement. Moneys from fines and penalties collected from issuers for violations of this Act shall be deposited into the Insurance Producer Administration Fund for appropriation by the General Assembly to the Department to be used for providing financial support of the Department's enforcement of this Act.

sections.heading: Uniform electronic provider directory information notification forms.
sections.text: Uniform electronic provider directory information notification forms.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
